required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Application of the Umbilical Cord Mesenchymal Stem Cells in the Complex Treatment of Chronic Heart Failure of Non-ischemic Etiology
clinical_study.official_title: Optimization of the Complex Treatment of Nonischemic Dilated Cardiomyopathy Due to the Addition to the Standard Drug Therapy of Intracoronary Administration of Umbilical Cord-derived Mesenchymal Stromal Cells

lead_sponsor.agency: The Research-Clinical Center for Cardiac Surgery and Transplantology LLP

collaborator.agency: State-Financed Health Facility "Samara Regional Medical Center Dinasty"

clinical_study.source: The Research-Clinical Center for Cardiac Surgery and Transplantology LLP

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to optimize the complex treatment of chronic heart failure of non-ischemic etiology by supplementing umbilical cord mesenchymal stem cells to the standard drug therapy.

detailed_description.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to optimize the complex treatment of non-ischemic dilated cardiomyopathy by supplementing the standard drug therapy with intracoronary administration of umbilical cord-derived mesenchymal stromal cells.
Sixty patients will be selected and randomly divided into the main and control groups in a 1: 1 ratio.
Patients of the main group will receive complex treatment based on the addition to the standard drug therapy of intracoronary administration of 10 million mesenchymal stromal cells of the umbilical cord, and patients of the control group will receive only standard drug therapy.
Every patient will maintain their standard treatment of chronic heart failure, with maximum tolerated dosage without side effects.
The day of infusion will be considered day zero. From that moment, followup will be divided into 0-1,1-3 and 3-6 months.
Clinical results will be analyzed after completion of 6 months of followup.

primary_outcome.measure: change in the contractile function of the heart
primary_outcome.description: changes in the ejection fraction of the right and left ventricles evaluated by transthoracic echocardiography and computed tomography

primary_outcome.measure: change in the size of the heart
primary_outcome.description: changes in the size of the right and left atrium, end diastolic and end systolic size of the right and left ventricles evaluated by transthoracic echocardiography and computed tomography

primary_outcome.measure: change in the volumes of the heart
primary_outcome.description: changes in the volumes of the right and left atrium, end diastolic and end systolic volumes of the right and left ventricles evaluated by transthoracic echocardiography and computed tomography

secondary_outcome.measure: change in the clinical condition evaluated by the Scale for Heart failure to Optimize Clinical Status
secondary_outcome.description: changes in the clinical condition evaluated by the Scale for Heart failure to Optimize Clinical Status (SHOCS). The SHOCS scale consists of 10 points. The maximum possible score is 20, and the minimum is 0. Higher scores indicate a worse or worsening clinical condition, while lower scores or decreasing scores indicate a better clinical condition.

secondary_outcome.measure: change in the markers of myocardial dysfunction
secondary_outcome.description: changes in the markers of myocardial dysfunction of the serum level of amino-terminal pro-brain natriuretic peptide

secondary_outcome.measure: change in the in the 6-minute walk test
secondary_outcome.description: changes in the 6-minute walk test, defined as the changes in the distance of traveled
change in the functional status according to the New York Heart Association classification

secondary_outcome.measure: change in the quality of life evaluated by the questionnaire Short Form 12 Healthy Survey
secondary_outcome.description: change in the quality of life evaluated by the questionnaire Short Form 12 Healthy Survey (SF-12). The SF 12 questionnaire consists of 12 items. The low level of the quality of life corresponds to estimates of 36-47 points, average of 24-35 points, high of 12-23 points.

secondary_outcome.measure: change in the quality of life evaluated by the Kansas City Cardiomyopathy Questionnaire
secondary_outcome.description: changes in the quality of life evaluated by the Kansas City Cardiomyopathy Questionnaire (KCCQ). The KCCQ is composed of 23 items. The options for the answers are of 1 to 5, 6 or 7 points and the score of each of its dimensions has a theoretical range from 0 to 100, 100 being the best outcome.

secondary_outcome.measure: change in the quality of life evaluated by the Minnesota Living with Heart Failure Questionnaire
secondary_outcome.description: changes in the quality of life evaluated by the Minnesota Living with Heart Failure (MLHF) Questionnaire. The MLHF questionnaire is composed of 21 items. The maximum possible scores being 105 and the minimum 0. Higher scores indicate a worse or worsening quality of life, while lower scores or decreasing scores indicate a better quality of life.

arm_group.description: Patients of the main group will undergo cardiac catheterization with intracoronary administration of 1×10 (7) umbilical cord-derived mesenchymal stromal cells and and will continue to receive optimal pharmacological therapy
Patients in the control group will only have cardiac catheterization and will continue to receive optimal pharmacological therapy

intervention.description: Catheterization of the right and left heart cavities

intervention.intervention_name: Intracoronary administration of the umbilical cord-derived mesenchymal stromal cells
intervention.description: After performing cardiac catheterization, selective coronary angiography will be performed abruptly to assess the condition of the coronary canal by access through the right radial or common femoral artery on the right after 70 U/kg of heparin iv. Then 20 ml of the finished suspension (1×10(7) umbilical cord-derived mesenchymal stromal cells diluted in 20 ml of heparinized saline) will be administrated into the mouth of the left coronary artery (LCA) without occlusion of the vessel with a balloon catheter and without stopping the coronary blood flow. Cell injection will be carried out using a standard 6 Fr catheter for selective coronary angiography with perfusion for 10 minutes at a volume rate of 2 ml/min, thereby introducing 1×10(6) cells per minute

overall_official.affiliation: The Research-Clinical Center for Cardiac Surgery and Transplantology LLP

facility.name: The Research-Clinical Center for Cardiac Surgery and Transplantology LLP

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: The Research-Clinical Center for Cardiac Surgery and Transplantology LLP
